str2: A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
An herb, garden plant, vegetable. From lachaino; a vegetable.
